label: 宝幢仏
本: Jewel in the Ashes: Buddha Relics and Power in Early Medieval Japan . Harvard University Asia Center . 2000
説明文: Hōdō butsu宝幢仏, also called 宝星, 南方, 羅怛曩計覩 Hōshō, Nanpō, Ratanaketo. This Buddha (Sk. Ratnaketu) is one of the 5 main Buddhas of the Womb realm mandala, residing in the east among the five, and is sometimes identified with Hōshō. In the Diamond realm, he is identified ultimately with Ashuku. Usually depicted with a flame to the rear, he is particularly associated with the fire of wisdom, which overcomes the threat of demons.
